name: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. In a separate pan, heat olive oil and sauté the onion and garlic until golden. Add the minced beef and cook until browned. Add the tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, and simmer for 15 minutes. Serve the sauce over the spaghetti.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
instructions: Grill the chicken breast until fully cooked, then slice it into strips. Toss the romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing, croutons, and parmesan cheese. Top with the grilled chicken slices and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla extract, and mix until smooth. Stir in the boiling water last. Pour the batter into a greased and floured cake pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes. Allow to cool before serving.

name: Beef Tacos
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat. Add the taco seasoning and water, and simmer for 5 minutes. Fill the taco shells with the beef mixture and top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, and salsa.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
instructions: Cook the rice according to the package instructions. In a large pan or wok, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté for 1 minute. Add the broccoli, carrot, bell pepper, and snap peas, and stir fry for 5-7 minutes until tender-crisp. Add the soy sauce and stir to combine. Serve the vegetables over the cooked rice.

name: Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, whisk together the milk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
